intro: Randia panamensis, commonly known as Panama randia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It produces small, berry-like fruits that are typically red when mature. Randia panamensis is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests.
